intro: Cybistax subtomentosa, commonly known as the silky cybistax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
